noun.description: A surprise attack by people lying in wait in a concealed position.
examples: seven members of a patrol were killed in an ambush

verb.description: Make a surprise attack on (someone) from a concealed position.
examples: they were ambushed and taken prisoner by the enemy

origin: Middle English (in the sense place troops in hiding in order to surprise an enemy): from Old French embusche (noun), embuschier (verb), based on a late Latin word meaning to place in a wood; related to bush.
